source: Expreso; El Comercio (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); El Heraldo (Ecuador)
notes: On 29 June 2022, in Ambato (Tungurahua), at least 800 Indigenous citizens supporters of the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE) fell trees on the streets and next to national television and radio facilities at the Pilishurco hill as a demonstration to demand the government to set fixed fuel prices, to give fair prices to farm produces and to stop labor insecurity. Around 80 truck drivers and Indigenous citizens also blocked the Cevallos Avenue, and people also blocked Ambato-Riobamba highway in Manzana de Oro sector. The event follows a set of nationwide demonstrations summoned by CONAIE. Demonstrators disconnected tv and radio antennas and interrupted communications in several provinces.

assoc_actor_1: CONAIE: Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador; Indigenous Group (Ecuador)
notes: On 29 June 2022, in Otavalo (Imbabura), Indigenous citizens supporters of the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE) demonstrated to demand the government to set fixed fuel prices, to give fair prices to farm produces and to stop labor insecurity. This follows a set of nationwide demonstrations summoned by CONAIE, that had been carried out for seventeen consecutive days. Demonstrators punctured tires of ambulances and intimidated health workers trying to cross roads.

assoc_actor_1: CONAIE: Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador; Indigenous Group (Ecuador)
notes: On 29 June 2022, in San Miguel de Ibarra (Imbabura), Indigenous citizens supporters of the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE) blocked roads as a demonstration to demand the government to set fixed fuel prices, to give fair prices to farm produces and to stop labor insecurity. This follows a set of nationwide demonstrations summoned by CONAIE, that had been carried out for seventeen consecutive days. Demonstrators punctured tires of ambulances and threatened health workers trying to cross roads.

On 29 June 2022, near San Lorenzo de Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an explosive artefact was detonated in a house located in the 9th of October neighbourhood of San Lorenzo del Pailon community. Perpetrators and motivation of the attack are unknown. The targeted family had suffered similar attacks two times before. A person was arrested. There were no fatalities.

assoc_actor_1: CONAIE: Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador; Indigenous Group (Ecuador); Labor Group (Ecuador)
notes: On 28 June 2022, near Cuenca (Azuay), taxi drivers and delivery service workers in support of CONAIE protests, to demand the government to set fixed fuel prices, to give fair prices to farm produces and to stop labor insecurity. Some of the protesters rode motorcycles. This follows a set of nationwide demonstrations summoned by CONAIE, that had been carried out for sixteen consecutive days.

assoc_actor_1: CONAIE: Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador; Indigenous Group (Ecuador); Shuar Indigenous Group (Ecuador); Ashuar Indigenous Group (Ecuador)
notes: On 28 June 2022, in Macas (Morona Santiago), Shuar and Ashuar Indigenous citizens supporters of the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE) marched to the Governorate of the province to demand the government to set fixed fuel prices, to give fair prices to farm produces and to stop labor insecurity. This follows a set of nationwide demonstrations summoned by CONAIE, that had been carried out for sixteen consecutive days. During the march, demonstrators detained the head of BanEcuador banking entity for 18 hours. This as a way to force the resignation of the Morona Santiago governor. It was reported that rioters threw water mixed with sauce to the detained man. The victim was released on 29 June.

assoc_actor_1: CONAIE: Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador; Indigenous Group (Ecuador)
notes: On 28 June 2022, in Quito - Calderon (Pichincha), around 300 people held a demonstration in San Miguel del Comun sector, where police forces clashed with them and used tear gas to disperse them. They demonstrated in support of the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE), which demand the government to set fixed fuel prices, to give fair prices to farm produces and to stop labor insecurity. There were rumours that a minor died due to the gas and that other children had been affected (unconfirmed). Rioters, armed with sticks and stones, attacked, vandalized and burned two police stations. Three people were arrested.

source: Expreso; El Universo (Ecuador); El Heraldo (Ecuador); Diario Regional Los Andes
notes: On 28 June 2022, in Shushufindi (Sucumbios), around 100 indigenous citizens, armed with firearms and spears, ambushed and attacked a military convoy transporting diesel to an oil plant. A military officer was killed and 12 others were injured during the clash, and a truck was burnt. The clash took place amidst nationwide demonstrations summoned by the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE), which had been carried out for sixteen consecutive days. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Regional Los Andes; El Comercio (Ecuador)
notes: On 27 June 2022, in Puyo (Pastaza), more than 40 Indigenous residents armed with spears occupied the Community Police Unit (UPC) where the ECU 911 police emergency attention service, in support of the nationwide demonstrations carried out by the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE) to demand the government to set fixed fuel prices, to give fair prices to farm produces and to stop labor insecurity. In addition, Indigenous citizens also marched to demand the resignation of the Pastaza governor following the killing of an indigenous citizen as a result of the police repression of a protest on 21 June (coded separately). The march was held amidst nationwide demonstrations summoned by the CONAIE, which had been carried out for fifteen consecutive days.

This follows a set of nationwide demonstrations summoned by CONAIE, that had been carried out for fifteen consecutive days.

On 27 June 2022, in Quito - Calderon (Pichincha), a group of rioters attacked a police station (methods unknown). Although the motivation of the attack was not confirmed, it is likely that the action takes part of nationwide demonstrations summoned by the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE), that had been carried out for fifteen consecutive days.

On 27 June 2022, in Ambato (Tungurahua), residents of Santa Cruz neighborhood staged a demonstration in Bolivarian avenue to demand the stop of the nationwide demonstrations led by supporters of the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE) to stop so they can reopen their businesses that have been closed for two weeks. CONAIE supporters have been demanding the government to set fixed fuel prices, to give fair prices to farm produces and to stop labor insecurity.

assoc_actor_1: CONAIE: Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador; Indigenous Group (Ecuador)
notes: On 27 June 2022, in Ambato (Tungurahua), Indigenous citizens supporters of the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE) blocked the North Panamerican highway next to the Industrial Park as a demonstration to demand the government to set fixed fuel prices, to give fair prices to farm produces and to stop labor insecurity. This follows a set of nationwide demonstrations summoned by CONAIE, that had been carried out for fifteen consecutive days. During the demonstration, rioters threw stones and a police officer was injured. Journalists who were broadcasting the event claimed to have been threatened.

assoc_actor_1: Health Workers (Ecuador)
notes: On 27 June 2022, in Ambato (Tungurahua), health workers staged a demonstration outside the Ambato General Hospital of the Social Security Institute (IESS) to demand peace in the country and to call for a halt to the violent acts in the demonstrations carried out by supporters of the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE). CONAIE supporters have been demanding the government set fixed fuel prices, to give fair prices to farm produces and to stop labor insecurity.

notes: On 25 June 2022, near Cuenca (Azuay), indigenous citizens supporters of the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE) blocked the highways to Mendez, Sigsig, Alausi, and Machala as a demonstration to demand the government to set fixed fuel prices, to give fair prices to farm produces and to stop labor insecurity. While they demonstrated in Tarqui bifurcation, police forces attempted to disperse them and they clashed against the officers. They used tear gas to disperse them. Eight demonstrators were arrested and an unknown number of officers and Indigenous residents were injured. This follows a set of nationwide demonstrations summoned by CONAIE, that had been carried out for thirteen consecutive days.

notes: On 25 June 2022, in Macas (Morona Santiago), a group of at least 70 rioters violently entered a building where the ECU 911 police emergency attention service operates, and smashed the furniture, computers, and personal belongings of ECU workers, among other things. The motivation and identity of the perpetrators are unknown, although it is likely that the action is part of nationwide demonstrations carried out by the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE) to demand the government to set fixed fuel prices, to give fair prices to farm produces and to stop labor insecurity. The ECU 911 services were interrupted.

On 24 June 2022, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), for the fourth consecutive day, residents staged a demonstration in Shyris Tribune to reject the current nation-wide demonstrations carried out by indigenous citizens supporters of the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE). They demanded the CONAIE to stop violent acts, to let them work again and to implement a dialogue with the government.

notes: On 23 June 2022, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), indigenous citizens supporters of the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE) staged a demonstration in El Arbolito park to demand the government to set fixed fuel prices, to give fair prices to farm produces and to stop labor insecurity. During the demonstration police officers clashed with the demonstrators. Officers used tear gas to disperse them. During the clash, a demonstrator was killed by a pellet shot, but the government minister claimed that officers were not authorized to use pellets and that some officers were injured by pellets as well, attributing the violence to the demonstrators. This follows a set of national demonstrations summoned by CONAIE, that had been carried out for eleven consecutive days. 1 fatality.

Several windows were damaged. This happened during the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE) nation-wide demonstrations that have been carried out for eleven consecutive days.

notes: On 18 June 2022, in Aloag (Pichincha), Indigenous citizens supporters of the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE) blocked roads with tree trunks and burned tires in Aloag Alto sector as a demonstration to demand the government to set fixed fuel prices, to give fair prices to farm produces and to stop labour insecurity. assoc_actor_1: CONAIE: Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador; Indigenous Group (Ecuador)

assoc_actor_1: Shuar Indigenous Group (Ecuador); CONAIE: Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador; Indigenous Group (Ecuador)
source: Diario Regional Los Andes; El Universo (Ecuador); El Comercio (Ecuador)
notes: On 17 June 2022, in Puyo (Pastaza), Shuar indigenous citizens, armed with Molotov bombs, machetes, and spears took control of the regional government building as a demonstration to support the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE) nationwide demonstrations. CONAIE supporters are demanding the government to set fixed fuel prices, to give fair prices to farm produces and to stop labour insecurity. A military officer was injured. The occupation persisted until 30 June.

assoc_actor_1: CONAIE: Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador; Indigenous Group (Ecuador)
notes: On 17 June 2022, in Quito - La Delicia (Pinchina), a group of 20 Indigenous citizens driving three trucks attacked a civilian who was not following nationwide demonstrations summoned by the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE). According to the victim, rioters punctured the tires of his vehicle to prevent him from advancing.

assoc_actor_1: CONAIE: Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador; Indigenous Group (Ecuador); Students (Ecuador); Labor Group (Ecuador); Teachers (Ecuador); Health Workers (Ecuador); FP: Popular Front
notes: On 16 June 2022, in Cuenca (Azuay), indigenous citizens supporters of the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE) blocked different roads of the city as a demonstration to demand the government to set fixed fuel prices, to give fair prices to farm produces and to stop labour insecurity. This follows a set of national demonstrations summoned by CONAIE. On the same day, students, teachers, trade unions, health workers, members of the Popular Front, and workers from the Cuenca University marched to the Azuay Governorate on the same claims and additional ones, like autonomy for universities.

assoc_actor_1: CONAIE: Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador; Indigenous Group (Ecuador); Students (Ecuador); Labor Group (Ecuador); UNE: National Union of Educators; FP: Popular Front; Teachers (Ecuador)
notes: On 16 June 2022, in Quito - Manuela Saenz (Pichincha), indigenous citizens supporters of the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE), members of the National Union of Educators (UNE), the Popular Front (PF), students, and other social groups marched to Santo Domingo square to demand the government to set fixed fuel prices, to give fair prices to farm produces and to stop labour insecurity. Demonstrators removed security fences, broke cobblestones, and threw objects against police forces, who persecuted on motorcycles and used tear gas to disperse the crowd. At least one person was injured. This follows a set of national demonstrations summoned by CONAIE.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Ecuador); CONAIE: Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador; Indigenous Group (Ecuador)
notes: On 16 June 2022, in Loja (Loja), heavy, interprovincial, between cantons transportation workers, and taxi drivers staged a demonstration in 8 de Diciembre avenue, inside the local bus station, and in four roads of access to Loja. They supported the nation-wide Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE) demonstrations to demand the government to set fixed fuel prices, to give fair prices to farm produces and to stop labor insecurity. They demanded fuel subsidies to be focalized to transportation works to avoid raising bus fares, and public banks to buy-out their private bank loans so that interest rates can be lowered and renegotiate the payment time. The blockades persisted on 17 June.

assoc_actor_2: CONAIE: Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador; Indigenous Group (Ecuador)
notes: On 14 June 2022, in San Francisco del Chasqui (Cotopaxi), the president of the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE) was arrested by police officers after President Guillermo Lasso claimed that he was the primary instigator for the acts of violence and vandalism committed during the nationwide demonstrations (coded separately). The acts include the burning of a police car, invasion of private farms, attacks to private cars and school busses, the attack of a oil pump facility, potable water cuts to communities and blockages and damages to state highways. This happened during the nationwide demonstrations to demand the government to set fixed fuel prices, to give fair prices to farm produces and to stop labor insecurity.

Their protest concentrated on demanding more reconstruction and attention to merchants to reactivate the economy after the earthquake that happened in April 2016 and devastated most of the coastal cities in Ecuador.

On 5 January 2018, Supporters of Rafael Correa wanted to place a wreath in ceremony of the 11 year anniversary of the Citizen's Revolution that started with Correa. However the event turned into a violent confrontation with the police forces that tried to remove the wreath and disperse the supporters of Correa. Tear gas was used by the police force and no injured came from the event.

On 4 January 2018, Citizens around the sector of Simon Bolivar Highway in the south of Quito, blocked the highway to demand actions about the run over of a child the day before. The reason, the citizens mention, is that the elevated crosswalk has not been fixed and they demanded for them to receive the required attention to their problems.

On 12 January 2018, Protesters against Rafael Correa (MRC) did not allow the ex president to pass with his caravan to support the referendum to allow him to run again. The protest happened on the main highway of Machala

On 13 January 2018, Protesters against Rafael Correa gathered outside the hotel where the ex president was gathered with his followers in Cuenca. This happened during Correa's campaign to vote for 'No' in the upcoming referendum that would not let Correa run as president again.

assoc_actor_1: Farmers (Ecuador)
notes: On 22 January 2018, Rice producers closed roads in Taura, Guayas in protest because the price of their products is not being respected and even reduced by big companies. Their protest wanted to call out the government for help for people to respect their produce prices.

On 5 January 2018, in Puyo, Pastaza, a woman known to be an indigenous human rights defender was attacked by an unidentified individual who threw rocks at her house and leaft a death threat in her house.
tags: women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders

notes: On 2 January 2018, Rafael Correa was giving an interview in Quininde, when a group of rioters graffitied and threw trash at the ex-president's car in sign of violent demonstration against the campaign for voting 'no' in the upcoming referendum.
